descriptions: No goal is set; no plan for physical activity increase is evident.
Goal is vague and lacks specifics; the plan is unclear and unrealistic.
Goal is somewhat specific but lacks measurable elements; the plan is basic but may not be fully practical.
Goal is specific and measurable, but the plan could be more detailed or personalized.
Goal is well-defined, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART); the plan is detailed and considers personal preferences and barriers.
Goal is exceptionally well-defined and SMART; the plan is comprehensive, highly personalized, and includes strategies for overcoming potential challenges.
One or two vague actions identified.
A few actions identified, but missing key information.
Actions identified are clear, but not easily measurable.
Multiple and clear actions identified with frequency and time included.
Detailed actions identified that incorporate multiple methods to incorporate into their daily life.
Identifies habits that they consider unhealthy.
Reflection is surface level and doesn't indicate true feelings.
Reflection on habits is present and indicates what they will need to do in order to change them.
Thoroughly describes old habits and shows what they will need to do in order to meet goals.
Student uses critical thinking to identify habits and what will be involved in change and any possible external influences to create a solid plan.
